Articles.Content:
I want to improve the terrain (up close), make it more realistic for RSS.

When I was using SSRSS the Terrain when orbiting up close looked really good.

With RSS that I am using, the terrain looks more artificial. Can someone tell me what I could do to enhance terrain on different planets.? 

Apparently in rss-textures I read somewhere that you can change/try different textures. How does one do this?

 

Thank you.

Edited October 5, 2016 by KERBALINA

@KERBALINA what is the resolution of the RSS texture pack that you have installed? 8K is the maximum resolution offered by RSS.

Also remember that the Earth Scaled Space texture has to cover approximately 510064471909788 square meters, in comparison with the 4523893421169 square meters of Kerbin (a surface area about 112 times larger). As a result one pixel will have to cover a much larger surface.

I have 8k textures currently installed. Earlier I had 2048.

The 8k has a big improvement on Mars. Earth is good too. Close up of Callisto's terrain when flying close by, the textures are not clear enough, with SSRSS the textures where fantastic. But as you said 1 pixel has to cover a larger area so its a stretch must be.

(Also Titan close up was horrid. very blurry terrain, could not make nothing out. This is still in 8k)

I wanted to try RSS to experience play in a more scaled version of the Solar System we live in.

But it seems to me if I want really good clear textures I have to revert back to SSRSS! Don't get me wrong I love SSRSS! its awesome!
